title: The Mystery of the Michelin Starred Restaurant

sections.Resolution: The culprit is Eigo Kuchiishi. He did it to avenge his father.
sections.Trivia:
- The prefix Kuchi in Eigo and his father's surname (Kuchiishi) probably comes from the italian word Cucina that means cooking or kitchen and because Eigo is a cook specialized in italian cuisine and his restaurant's name is Cucina Eigo.
- The Michelin Guide also called red guide because of its color is a travel guide written by the french tire manufacturer Michelin and was first written in 1900. It selects every year restaurants and hotels around the world based on its own criteria. It has now around 15,725 restaurants, of whom 857 are in Japan, more than any other country in the world. 22 of them are 3 stars, 73 are 2 stars and a staggering 318 are 1 star. At the time of the episode's broadcast, there were 437 Michelin starred restaurants in Tokyo and its surroundings including 12 three-stars restaurants, 42 two-stars restaurants and 153 one-star restaurants. It is unknown how many stars Cucina Eigo has.
- The car parked in front of Cucina Eigo is a Alpine white 2002 BMW 330i E46 LCI with the license plate written: 新宿 800, あ 82-04 (Shinjuku 800, A 82-04).
- The employee van is a 2005 Subaru Dias Wagon [TV].
- The mystery of what happened on the Mary Celeste is directly referenced early in the case.
